page.title: 03FARMING IN DALBEATTIE AREA
page.content: Altogether in our area of Dalbeattie there are nine farms.Most farms rear sheep and cattle for meat,but some are dairy farms. The dairy farms send their milk to Dalbeattie Creamery where it is made into cheese.This cheese is sold all over the world. Every farm covers on average 350 acres of land.The most common crops are barley,grass for silage and green crop.These crops are grown mostly for the farmer's own use. Some farms fatten up their animals before taking them to market in Castle Douglas to be sold for butcher meat. Mr Hyslop of West Logan Farm won a major award at the Royal Highland Show this year with his prize Charollais sheep.
